abstract: During the Chinese cultural revolution, 69 Chinese Communist students were treated violently by the Soviet police, prompting the Chinese embassy in Moscow to protest.
lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Soviet police roughed up 69 Communist Chinese students today when they tried to lay wreaths at the Red Square tombs of Lenin and Stalin, the New China News Agency announced today.
snippet: During the Chinese cultural revolution, 69 Chinese Communist students were treated violently by the Soviet police, prompting the Chinese embassy in Moscow to protest....

headline.main: 1967: Chinese Say Moscow Police Roughed Up Students
